intro: Heteranthocidium colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian heteranthocidium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically have five petals, though some variations may show differences in petal size and color. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
